alert.note: Alert for Norman (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 3:25PM CDT until April 16 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Forks ND has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... Marsh River at Shelly affecting Norman County. .Rain and snow have caused rises on the Marsh River. Crest is anticipated to be over the next 2 days in minor flood stage. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Marsh River at Shelly. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD STAGE. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 PM CDT Wednesday was 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.7 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
